name: MELBOURNE
cost_popup:
Melbourne: For a cohort recruited in 2007–2013, the average disease-associated costs were as follows.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total: AUS$ 10,477 AUS$ 6,292
Medical hospitalization: AUS$ 6,493 AUS$ 6,292
Surgical hospitalization: AUS$ 15,283 AUS$ 35,506
Medications: AUS$ 3,366 AUS$ 2,447
Diagnostic tests: AUS$ 2,196 AUS$ 1,825

Note that biologics were 16% of CD cost but only 1% of UC cost (Niewiadomski 2015).

Another cohort recruited between 2014 and 2015 had the following annual median costs depending on treatment status.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total: AUS$ 15,648 AUS$ 5,017
Remission: AUS$ 4,613 AUS$ 1,833
Active: AUS$ 5,495 AUS$ 1,776
Hospitalized: AUS$ 32,554 AUS$ 13,334
Ambulatory: AUS$ 9,602 AUS$ 4,966

Note that hospitalization was 63% of total IBD cost, while medications were 35% (Jackson 2017).
indirect_cost_popup: NA

name: Austria
cost_popup: NA
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort of Austrian UC/CD Association members from 2018 to 2019 were found to have the following mean annual IBD-related productivity losses.
  IBD
All patients: € 7,411
Active disease: € 12,377
Remission: € 6,040

Values are based on participants' 7-day recall (Walter 2020).

name: Brazil
cost_popup: NA
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A large cohort followed between 2010 and 2014 received the following mean disability pension payout per year.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Temporary: US$ 3221 US$ 2706
Permanent: US$ 5698 US$ 5077

Includes prevalent cases. Benefits higher in CD than UC. Both types of benefits tended to fall between 2010 and 2014 (Froes 2018).

Rio de Janeiro: A cohort of individuals with Crohn's disease followed between 2010 and 2018 recieved the following mean annual disability pension payout.
  Crohn's Disease
Temporary: US$ 3340
Permanent: US$ 6638

Includes all prevalent cases (Froes 2020).

name: RIO DE JANEIRO
cost_popup: NA

Rio de Janeiro: A cohort of individuals with Crohn's disease followed between 2010 and 2018 recieved the following mean annual disability pension payout.
  Crohn's Disease
Temporary: US$ 3340
Permanent: US$ 6638

Includes all prevalent cases (Froes 2020).

name: Canada
cost_popup:
Calgary, Alberta: A cohort of hospitalized ulcerative colitis patients from 2001 to 2009 had the following median annual disease-associated costs.

  Ulcerative Colitis
Medical: CAN$ 5,499
Elective colectomy: CAN$ 14,316
Emergent colectomy: CAN$ 23,698

Predictors of cost included calendar year, age, current smoker, disease extent, infliximab, length of admission (Coward 2015).

Manitoba: In a cohort recruited between 2005 and 2006, the average disease-associated costs were as follows.

  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Prevalent: CAN$ 4,232  CAN$ 3,552
Incident: CAN$ 6,750 CAN$ 3,190
Male: CAN$ 3,989 CAN$ 3,513
Female: CAN$ 4,407 CAN$ 3,588
Hospitalization: CAN$ 12,900 CAN$ 14,183
Surgery: CAN$ 18,154 CAN$ 19,763
Age ≤ 18 y: CAN$ 4,174 CAN$ 3,364
Age 19-64 y: CAN$ 3,875 CAN$ 2,714
Age 65-79 y: CAN$ 5,442 CAN$ 5,204
Age 80-102 y: CAN$ 8372 CAN$ 8,675

Medication accounted for > 40% of overall costs (Bernstein 2012).

In a second Manitoba cohort, followed between 2005 and 2015, the following disease-related costs were observed.

  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total:    
2005 CAN$ 4,640 CAN$ 2,194
2015 CAN$ 10,747 CAN$ 5,065
Anti-TNF:    
2005 CAN$ 671 CAN$ 38
2015 CAN$ 7,754 CAN$ 2,650
Hospitalization:    
2005 CAN$ 2,565 CAN$ 790
2015 CAN$ 1,426 CAN$ 1,016

Anti-TNF escalated total costs. Decreased hospitalization costs in UC failed to reduce overall cost (Targownik 2019).

name: Denmark
cost_popup:
National: A cohort recruited between 2003 and 2015 was followed for 5 years. The disease-associated costs were as follows.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
  Year 1 Year 5 Year 1 Year 5
Outpatients: € 3,851 € 2,185 € 1,722 € 578
Hospitalization: € 4,745 € 107 € 2,066 -€ 3
Medications: € 399 € 187 € 476 € 308

CD more expensive than UC for direct costs. Year 1 costs were higher than subsequent years (Vadstrup 2020).
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort recruited between 2003 and 2015 was followed for 5 years. The indirect disease-associated costs were as follows.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
  Year 1 Year 2 Year 1 Year 2
Productivity: € 3,990 € 3,155 € 2,499 € 1,535
Home care: € 33 € 24 € 67 € 39

A Human Capital approach was used. Direct and indirect costs decreased each year after onset. CD more expensive than UC for indirect costs. About one-third of year 1 total cost due to indirect costs. In years 2-5, productivity losses were the main cost driver in CD and UC (Vadstrup 2020).

name: COPENHAGEN
cost_popup:
Copenhagen: Incident cases occuring between 2003 and 2015 had the following annual mean disease-associated costs.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total: € 6,600 € 4,700
Hospitalization: € 4,100 € 2,900
Surgery: € 700 € 300
Biologics: € 736 € 120
Other meds: € 290 € 535
Investigations: € 800 € 800

CD had higher costs than UC. In CD, cost of biologics increased upon follow-up. In UC, disease extent predicted cost. In CD, phenotype did not predict cost (Lo 2019).
indirect_cost_popup:
Copenhagen: Incident cases occuring between 2003 and 2015 had the following annual median societal costs when matched with controls by age, sex and place of residence.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Sick leave: € 1,100 € 1,100
Social security benefits: € 1,900 € 1,500
Loss of revenue from income tax: € 700 € 800

Indirect costs in IBD patients and controls were similar. Indirect costs in UC were driven by young age (17-40 y) and smoking. CD had no specific predictors. After the first year, the total costs were dominated by direct costs in CD patients, and by indirect costs in UC patients (Lo 2019).

name: MINSK
cost_popup:
Multi-national (Croatia, Czech Republic, Estonia, Hungary, Lithuania, Moldova, Romania, Russia): The eastern European countries from a 2010 cohort involving participants from 20 European countries and Israel, were found to have the following mean annual disease-associated costs.

  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis IBDU
Total: € 4,812 € 2,464 € 1,814
Biologics: € 399 € 0 € 0

Across both western and eastern Europe, predictors of higher costs included diagnosis, age and Montreal classification. There was limited use of biologics (CD 20%, UC 8%) (Burisch 2015).

A continuation of the project until 2015 yielded the following.

Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis IBDU
Total: € 1,976 € 1,107 € 866

West-East differences derive from disparate health systems and availability of biologics. CD more expensive than UC or IBDU. Decreasing total cost, increasing cost of biologics, from year 1 onwards. Higher costs in severe phenotype, young age, smokers (CD and UC) (Burisch 2020).
indirect_cost_popup: NA

name: Finland
cost_popup: NA
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A 2015 to 2016 cohort experienced the following mean annual societal costs depending on absenteeism or presenteeism.
  Absenteeism Presenteeism
CD: € 724 € 763
UC: € 750 € 589
Men: € 531 € 495
Women: € 955 € 802
Biologics: € 933 € 1,079
Non-biologics: € 702 € 564

A human capital approach was used. Costs did not differ greatly between absenteeism and presentieeism groups (Rankala 2021).

name: Hungary
cost_popup: NA
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A 2012 to 2013 cohort had the following mean societal cost per person.
  IBD Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Disability pension (HCA): € 1,450 € 1,545 € 1,310
Disability pension (FCM): € 11.30 ~ ~
Sick leave:  € 430 € 395 € 485
Total productivity loss (HCA): € 1,880 € 1,940 € 1,795
Total productivity loss (FCM): € 445 ~ ~
Presenteeism: ~ € 2,605 € 2,410

A human capital approach and a friction cost method were used. The 2010 national full disability pension rates used for comparison. Full disability pension (DP) was more prevalent in CD (9.2%, p=0.009) but not in UC (6.6%, p=0.56) vs. background population (5.5%). Risk factors for DP in CD: age, previous surgery and arthritis/arthralgia (Mandel 2014).

cost_popup:

  Crohn's Disease
Total: € 18,838
Medications: € 9,366
Hospitalization: € 1,688

(Benedini 2012).
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort with Crohn's disease observed from 2006 to 2010 had the following annual mean disease-associated societal costs.
  Crohn's Disease
Productivity losses: € 2,784
Transport/Home assistance: € 899
Total indirect: € 3,685

(Benedini 2012).

name: Japan
cost_popup: NA
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort recruited between 2012 and 2014 had the following annual mean societal costs related to their disease.
  Indirect Cost
IBD: JPY 1,546,610
CD: JPY 1,645,068 
UC: JPY 1,562,054
Controls: JPY 1,067,331

Based on self-reported IBD diagnoses. No difference between CD and UC patients (Yamabe 2019).

name: Netherlands
cost_popup:
National: A cohort of prevalent IBD cases had the following mean annual disease-associated costs in 2011.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total: € 6,500 € 3,961
Outpatients: € 456 € 274
Diagnostics: € 162 € 119
Medications: € 414 € 652
Biologics: € 4,157 € 748
Hospitalization: € 1,261 € 555
Surgery: € 40 € 33

Biologics accounted for 64% of the cost in CD, 19% in UC. Mesalamine and biologics were the main cost drivers among medications in UC; in CD, the main driver was biologics (Van der Valk 2014).
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort of prevalent IBD cases had the following mean annual disease-associated societal costs in 2011.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total productivity losses: € 1,304 € 1,580
Sick leave, patients: € 1,156 € 1,448
Sick leave, caregivers: € 72 € 60
Lost earnings: € 76 € 72

Total productivity losses were 16% and 39% of total costs in CD and UC, respectively (Van der Valk 2014).
ref_popup: References: Van der Valk 2014, Van Gennep 2021

name: AMSTERDAM
cost_popup: NA
indirect_cost_popup:
Amsterdam: A 2017 to 2019 cohort had the following mean annual disease-associated societal cost per person.
  IBD
Absenteeism: € 1,738
Presenteeism: € 5,478
Overall work productivity losses: € 6,597

A human capital approach was used. Health-related quality of life correlated with productivity losses. Active disease, perianal disease, and fatigue predicted productivity losses. 50% of patients incurred productivity losses (Van Gennep 2021).

name: Poland
cost_popup: NA
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort of ulcerative colitis patients obsesrved during 2012 incurred the following mean annual societal costs.
  Ulcerative Colitis
Absenteeism:  
GPD € 1,260
GVA € 3,034
GI € 928

Macroeconomic indicators include: Gross Domestic Product (GDP), Gross Value Added (GVA), and Gross Income (GI). Most costs caused by sick leave (Malinowski 2015).

name: South Korea
cost_popup:
National: A cohort followed between 2005 and 2015 had the following mean annual disease-associated costs.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
2006 US$ 1,178 US$ 413
2007 US$ 1,497 US$ 402
2008 US$ 1,579 US$ 400
2009 US$ 1,859 US$ 400 
2010 US$ 2,138 US$ 423
2011 US$ 2,307 US$ 517
2012 US$ 2,521 US$ 574
2013 US$ 2,519 US$ 601
2014 US$ 2,853 US$ 679
2015 US$ 3,192 US$ 798

Predictors of cost included age at onset, hospitalization, surgery and anti-TNF medication. Annual use of biologics increased between 2006 and 2015; 39.8 –93.1% for CD patients and 0.4 – 84.5% for UC patients (Kim 2019).

Another study assessing incident cases between 2010 and 2012 found the following mean annual disease-associated costs.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Year: 1 2 3 1 2 3
Total: US$ 3,658 US$ 2,109 US$ 2,120 US$ 1,758 US$ 1,185 US$ 1,117
Biologics: US$ 774 US$ 1,052 US$ 1,274 US$ 108 US$ 215 US$ 282

Note that South Korea is an example of a country where UC cases still exceed CD. Biologics are a cost-driver. Total cost peaked in the first year after diagnosis, then decreased. First year costs driven by diagnostic procedures. Cost of biologics increased annually following diagnosis (Lee 2020).
indirect_cost_popup: NA

name: Spain
cost_popup:
National: A cohort consisting of prevalent ulcerative colitis cases recruited between 2002 and 2012 had the following mean annual disease-associated costs.
  Ulcerative Colitis
Total: € 1,754
GP consult: € 251
GI consult: € 117
Hospitalization: € 853
Medication: € 497
Other: € 37

Most consultations were with a GP. Medications: steroids + 5-ASA = 74%, IMM = 21%. Biologics not recorded (Aldeguer 2016).
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort consisting of prevalent ulcerative colitis cases recruited between 2002 and 2012 had the following mean annual disease-associated societal costs.
  Ulcerative Colitis
Productivity losses: € 399
Sick leave payments: € 311
Absenteeism: € 88

Indirect costs were 18.5% of total costs. Drivers of indirect costs were age, UC family history and psychological comorbidities. Indirect costs decreased with age (Aldeguer 2016).

name: Sweden
cost_popup:
National: A cohort recruited between 2010 and 2015 had the following mean annual disease-associated costs.

Prevalent cases:
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
  18-64 y ≥ 65 y 18-64 y ≥ 65 y
Biologics: US$ 4,495 US$ 1,407 US$ 1,471 US$ 436
Other meds: US$ 1,335 US$ 1,881 US$ 1,387 US$ 1,925
Outpatient: US$ 1,926 US$ 2,092 US$ 1,447 US$ 1,706
Hospitalization: US$ 2,338 US$ 4,346 US$ 1,619 US$ 4,004


Incident cases:
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
  18-64 y ≥ 65 y 18-64 y ≥ 65 y
Biologics: US$ 2,301 US$ 759 US$ 831 US$ 226
Hospitalization: US$ 5,152 US$ 10,367 US$ 3,204 US$ 7,556

64% of CD patients and 36% of UC patients recieved anti-TNF medication. There was greater expenditure on biologics for CD and in patients ages 18-64 y. Hospital charges were higher in older individuals (Khalili 2019).
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A cohort recruited between 2010 and 2015 had the following mean annual disease-associated societal costs.

Prevalent cases:
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Productivity losses: US$ 12,717 US$ 8,209
Sick leave: US$ 3,900 US$ 3,118
Disability pension: US$ 8,816 US$ 5,091

Incident cases:
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Productivity losses: US$ 12,102 US$ 8,852
Sick leave: US$ 5,858 US$ 4,073
Disability pension: US$ 6,243 US$ 4,778

Lost productivity accounted for 56% and 58% of the total annual societal costs of CD and UC patients, respectively. Prevalent CD patients had a mean avgerage of 63 days of sick leave per annum, while UC patients had 41 days. Incident CD patients of working age had a mean avgerage of 29 days of sick leave per annum, while UC patients had 24 days (Khalili 2019).

name: Switzerland
cost_popup:
National: A 2006 to 2016 cohort consisting of prevalent IBD cases had the following mean annual disease-associated costs.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total: € 9,504 € 5,704
Drugs: € 6,618 € 3,895
Inpatient: € 2,188 € 1,242
Outpatient: € 698 € 567

Intense drug use at enrolment: biologics for CD and immunomodulators for UC; at follow-up, biologics and immunomodulators for both CD and UC. The mean annual growth rate of total cost for CD and UC was 7% and 10% respectively (Pillai 2019).
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A 2006 to 2016 cohort consisting of prevalent IBD cases had the following mean annual disease-associated societal costs.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Productivity losses: € 1,339 € 707

A Human Capital approach was used. Data based on participant recall. Indirect costs were 12% and 11% of total costs in CD and UC, respectively. Large measure of uncertainty of data recall (Pillai 2019).

name: United States
cost_popup:
National: In 2003 to 2004, a cohort of participants with prevalent IBD from 33 states had the following mean annual direct costs.
  Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
Total: US$ 8,265 US$ 5,066
Surgery: US$ 1,026 US$ 807
Medical: US$ 1,567 US$ 1,099
ER: US$ 97 US$ 44
Endoscopy: US$ 266 US$ 306
Radiology: US$ 272 US$ 165
Outpatient: US$ 2,753 US$ 1,768
Medication: US$ 2,919 US$ 1,393

Predictors of higher cost in both sexes: age < 20 y. Predictors of greater need for hospitalization: diagnosis, age, gender, region, health insurance status (Kappelman 2008, Kappelman 2011).

A cohort of Crohn's disease patients from 2011 to 2013 had the following mean annual costs.
  Crohn's Disease
All patients: US$ 18637
High-cost patients: US$ 45602
Low-cost patients: US$ 8153
Men: US$ 18167
Women: US$ 18999
Age ≤ 20 y: US$ 22796
Age > 20 y: US$ 18095
Age 11-20 y: US$ 23409
Age 21-30 y: US$ 18946
Age 31-40 y: US$ 16628
Age 41-50 y: US$ 18343
Age 51-60 y: US$ 19151
Age 61-70 y: US$ 16814
Age 71-80 y: US$ 19237

Listed costs do not include participant co-payments! 28% of CD patients accounted for 80% of costs (drivers: anti-TNF, hospitalization). Anti-TNF accounted for 30%, and other medications for 16% of total cost. Cost of CD correlated with cost of co-morbidities. 55% of all patients had co-morbidities (Park 2015).

A 2007 to 2016 cohort of prevalent IBD cases had the following mean annual disease-associated costs.
  IBD Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis
2008 US$ 22000 ~ ~
2016 US$ 30000 ~ ~
Year 1: ~ US$ 30000 US$ 25000
Year 10: ~ US$ 38000 US$ 15000

Patient co-payments were partially included. Data was extrapolated from graphs. Predictors of higher costs: age <18 y or >65 y, biologics, and CD diagnosis (Park 2020).

A cohort of ulcerative colitis patients observed between 2005 and 2013 had the following mean annual disease-associated costs.
  UC (All Cases) UC (Moderate-severe)
Total direct: US$ 15378 US$ 22874
Hospitalization: US$ 4078 US$ 7357
Outpatients: US$ 6861 US$ 9245
Medication: US$ 4063 US$ 5741

(Cohen 2015)

When compared with controls, a ulcerative colitis cohort followed between 1999 and 2017 had the following mean annual disease-associated costs.
  Ulcerative Colitis Controls
Medical and pharmacy: US$ 18198 US$ 7170

(Pilon 2020)
indirect_cost_popup:
National: A 2007 to 2016 cohort of prevalent IBD cases had the following mean annual societal costs.
  IBD
Loss of wages: US$ 3000
Out-of-pocket expenses: US$ 2213

A Human Captial approach was used with average wages derived from the Bureau of Labour Statistics. IBD patients lost more in earnings than controls (Park 2020).

A 2005 to 2013 cohort of ulcerative colitis patients had the following mean annual disease-associated societal costs.
  All Cases Moderate-Severe
  UC Controls UC Controls
Total indirect: US$ 4125 US$ 1961 US$ 5666 US$ 1960
Disability: US$ 1727 US$ 829 US$ 2713 US$ 772
Absenteeism: US$ 2376 US$ 1082 US$ 3071 US$ 1128

A Human Capital approach that accounted for comorbidities was used. Direct costs greatly exceeded indirect costs in UC. Indirect costs higher in UC than controls (Cohen 2015).

An ulcerative colitis cohort observed from 1999 to 2017 had the following mean annual costs related to disability and absenteeism.
  Ulcerative Colitis
Total: US$ 5307
Controls: US$ 3165
Surgery: US$ 17343
On opiates: US$ 18591
Biologics: US$ 11898
Depression: US$ 8640
Moderate-severe: US$ 9720

A human capital approach was used. Co-morbidities were included. Direct healthcare costs were higher in UC than controls. Indirect costs were higher in UC than controls, and much higher in selected UC subgroups. Absenteeism was driven mostly by visits to physicians. Opioids were used in 68% of UC (Pilon 2020).
ref_popup: References: Kappelman 2008, Kappelman 2011, Cohen 2015, Park 2015, Park 2020, Pilon 2020

name: IPSWICH
cost_popup:
Multi-national (Cyprus, Denmark, Faroe Islands, Finland, Greece, Greenland, Ireland, Israel, Italy, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, UK): The western European countries from a 2010 cohort involving participants from 20 European countries and Israel, were found to have the following mean annual disease-associated costs.

Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis IBDU
Total: € 6,232 € 2,829 € 2,944
Biologics: € 1,366 € 273 € 231

Across both western and eastern Europe, predictors of higher costs included diagnosis, age and Montreal classification. There was limited use of biologics (CD 20%, UC 8%) (Burisch 2015).

A continuation of the project until 2015 yielded the following.

Crohn's Disease Ulcerative Colitis IBDU
Total: € 3,972 € 2,414 € 7,183

West-East differences derive from disparate health systems and availability of biologics. CD more expensive than UC or IBDU. Decreasing total cost, increasing cost of biologics, from year 1 onwards. Higher costs in severe phenotype, young age, smokers (CD and UC) (Burisch 2020).
indirect_cost_popup: NA
